results.headline: A Peek at Punk Paternity as Rockers Raise Families

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Other F Word

results.summary_short: “The Other F Word” invites a cross-section of aging punk rockers to dish on the demands of fatherhood.

results.headline: A Horoscope That Prompts a Long Journey

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 5 Star Day

results.summary_short: “Five Star Day” follows a young man who sets out to disprove the value of horoscopes as a final project for a college course.

results.headline: Someday His Horse Will Come (and Win)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of And They're Off

results.summary_short: “And They’re Off ...” is a horse-racing mockumentary about a losing trainer who gets a big chance.

results.headline: Choosing Sides in the Revolving-Spy Game

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Double

results.summary_short: Richard Gere plays a former C.I.A. operative called out of retirement in “The Double,” a spy thriller directed by Michael Brandt.

results.headline: Independent Filmmaker Fights That Old Ennui

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Silver Bullets

results.summary_short: “Silver Bullets,” Joe Swanberg’s feature about an independent director stalled by professional ennui, teeters between fiction and reality.

results.headline: A Fairy Tale Mix With 9 Lives and Dozens of Egg Jokes

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Puss In Boots

results.summary_short: “Puss in Boots” is a cheerfully chaotic jumble of fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters parachuted into a Spanish storybook setting.

results.headline: Higher Calling? It’s the Family Business

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Reincarnation

results.summary_short: Jennifer Fox’s documentary “My Reincarnation” examines a young man’s struggle to fulfill his destiny and become a spiritual teacher.

results.headline: In This Tale of Modern Love, a Visa Stands in the Way of Desire

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Like Crazy

results.summary_short: “Like Crazy” is about young lovers struggling to get their lives together and what happens when immigration policies keep them apart.

results.headline: Rocker Tests Daughter’s Music Chops and Mettle

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Janie Jones

results.summary_short: In David M. Rosenthal’s musical drama “Janie Jones,” a rocker’s best chance at redemption comes at the hands of his 15-year-old daughter, who displays a precocious musical talent.

results.headline: Die Young, Stay Pretty, and Watch Your Clock

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In Time

results.summary_short: “In Time,” with Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried, is a science-fiction thriller about a world where everyone stops aging at 25.

results.headline: In San Juan, on the Road to Gonzo

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Rum Diary

results.summary_short: “The Rum Diary,” based on an early novel by Hunter S. Thompson, stars Johnny Depp as a young writer named Paul Kemp, a Thompson alter ego.

results.headline: The Design of Cities, Intelligent or Otherwise

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Urbanized

results.summary_short: In “Urbanized,” the third film of his trilogy, the documentary maker Gary Hustwit considers the web of decisions that go into modern city planning.

results.headline: How Could a Commoner Write Such Great Plays?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Anonymous

results.summary_short: The premise of “Anonymous,” that the plays and poems commonly attributed to William Shakespeare were actually the work of Edward de Vere, 17th Earl of Oxford, is hardly new.

results.headline: Potential Wall Streeter Opts for the Renaissance Fair

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of All's Faire in Love

results.summary_short: Christina Ricci stars in Scott Marshall’s “All’s Faire in Love,” a backstage comedy set at a Renaissance fair.

results.headline: Get Rich (if You’re Lucky) or Die Trying

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 13

results.summary_short: Gela Babluani’s American remake of his prizewinning film, “13,” has its share of stars, including Sam Riley, Curtis Jackson, Mickey Rourke, Jason Statham and Michael Shannon.

results.headline: For a Boy Born Different, Sports as Salvation

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hammer

results.summary_short: “The Hammer” is based on Matt Hamill, the first deaf wrestler to win a national collegiate championship.

results.headline: Computer Nerd Creates Superhero Showdown

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ra.One

results.summary_short: For all its cost and special effects, the Bollywood sci-fi superhero thriller “Ra.One” is an old-fashioned story of good versus evil.

results.headline: When a Neurosis Is Part of the Attraction

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sidewalls

results.summary_short: In Gustavo Taretto’s “Sidewalls,” two soul mates live across the street from each other, but are separated by walls both real and virtual.

results.headline: All for One, and Then Maybe a Sequel

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Three Musketeers

results.summary_short: “The Three Musketeers” stars Christoph Waltz as the villainous Cardinal Richelieu.

results.headline: How Fame Divided Bandmates in Love

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Swell Season

results.summary_short: “The Swell Season,” about the Irish-Czech duo Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova, is less a musical documentary than the story of a breakup.
